newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian gold ends steady, silver up ahead of season.
newsitem.headline: Indian gold ends steady, silver up ahead of season.

text.p: Gold prices opened higher on the back of seasonal buying and recovery in the world market but remained steady at that level during the day amid limited activity, dealer said.
Gold was down by 30 rupees per 10 gramme on Tuesday.
Gold biscuit (116.50 gramme) settled 150 rupees higher at 59,900 rupees per piece.
They were down by 350 rupees on Tuesday.
Silver opened on a quiet note but fresh industrial buying and shortage of ready stock pushed up prices towards the close.
Silver was down by 80 rupees per kg on Tuesday.
"Some jewellers are cornering import licenses ahead of wedding season," one trader said.
